com.github.macgregor.alexandria

Class Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.macgregor.alexandria.Context

  • public class Context
extends Object
    Runtime context containing arguments passed from the user agent (e.g. search path, files to include or exclude, etc). This information is not persisted by Alexandria as it is considered specific to the runtime environment at execution that is not necessarily suitable distribution to others. Absolute paths are a good example of things that would break others if they were committed to git. Any paths in the context should be absolute, while paths in Config are relative.

      • Context

        public Context()

    • Method Detail

      • configPath

        public Context configPath(Path configPath)
        Sets the path to the Alexandria config file. Must be an absolute path. Resolving relative paths is system dependent. If we dont have a predictable absolute path to use as a reference point we may get into some weird states. It is up to the caller instantiating the context to properly set this absolute path so that Alexandria can accurately create absolute and relative paths as it works.
        Parameters:
        configPath - An absolute path to the Alexandria config file. Used to resolve all other relative and absolute paths.
        Returns:
        Alexandria context

      • resolveRelativePath

        public Path resolveRelativePath(Path relativePath)
        Resolve a relative path to an absolute one using the configPath directory. Useful for resolving relative Config.DocumentMetadata.sourcePath.
        Parameters:
        relativePath - relative path to convert to absolute
        Returns:
        the absolute path

      • documentCount

        public int documentCount()
        Convenience method for determining the size of the documentation index.
        Returns:
        Config.metadata size if present, otherwise 0

      • convertedPath

        public Optional<Path> convertedPath(Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
        Convenience method to retrieve the absolute converted file path in the cache for the given document.
        Parameters:
        metadata - indexed document to look for
        Returns:
        The converted path if it exist in the cache, otherwise Optional.empty()

      • convertedPath

        public void convertedPath(Config.DocumentMetadata metadata,
                          Path path)
        Convenience method to add a absolute converted file path to the cache.
        Parameters:
        metadata - indexed metadata that has been converted.
        path - absolute path to the converted html file for the document.

        public Context addMetadata(Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)

        Returns:

        public List<String> getTagsForDocument(Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)

        Returns:
        list of tags to add to the request or empty list if none are set

        Returns:
        map containing extra properties to use for processing a request

      • configureRemote

        protected Remote configureRemote()
                          throws AlexandriaException
        Instantiate a Remote implementation based on the Config.remote. The class instantiation logic is very simple, but should be adequate for this simple use case. Essentially we just pick the right class using the fully qualified class name in Config.RemoteConfig.clazz. Implementation specific configuration and validation is delegated to the implementing class by calling Remote.configure(Config.RemoteConfig) and Remote.validateRemoteConfig(). Only instantiates the remote implementation once, future calls to this method will return the value of remote.
        Returns:
        configured remote ready for use
        Throws:
        AlexandriaException - Exception wrapping any exception thrown instantiation, configuring or validating the remote
        See Also:
        NoopRemote

      • load

        public static Context load(String filePath)
                    throws IOException
        Initialize Alexandria's Context, loading the Config from the given file path. Required context paths will be set to the directory of filePath and should be appropriately overridden before performing any operations. If the path doesnt exist, a blank Config will be created and saved to filePath when saving.
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the config file where remote details and document metadata will be saved
        Returns:
        Initialized Alexandria context instance that will be provided to operations
        Throws:
        IOException - problems converting strings to paths or general file loading problems

      • save

        public static void save(Context context)
                 throws IOException
        Save the current context config (metadata and remote configuration) to disk. Not all information is saved, only the config field. See Config and Context.
        Parameters:
        context - context containing configuration to save
        Throws:
        IOException - problems saving the file
